I'm not totally sure what your question means. Of course the poles are connected. The poles are both on the surface of the Earth and that surface is continuous. You can't WALK all the way from North Pole to South Pole, because it's not land all the way. There is some water to cross. Even allowing for cold winters and a lot of ice between the North Pole and Canada, there is still quite a gap between Antarctica and South America. The poles are also connected through the body of the Earth, most directly along the Earth's rotational axis.
